did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physdesc: This collection consists of 10 business ledgers in two Hollinger boxes.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Hisey Myers Collection, Collection #2068, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. Virginia Hisey Myers, through Mr. Douglas Dellinger, in November 1989.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: This collection consists of ten business ledgers from L. M Hisey & Co. and Wightman & Hisey, 1894-1900. These businesses, located in Shenandoah County near Edinburgh, dealt in farm-related products and implements.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The ledgers in this collection document sales of and orders for agricultural and forestry items, especially phosphate, coal, wheat, bark, and lumber, as well as corn and tools such as plows. Some ledgers also contain financial information about the companies, such as lists of notes due. Receipts and bills, inserted in a few of the ledgers, further document the businesses.
These ledgers contain individual accounts, orders received, and other business dealings mostly concerning phosphate.
Individual accounts for lump and nut coal sold, including bushels, pounds, hauling, and price; and coal received.
